p:
The viral nuclear export protein NS2 is critical to nuclear export of vRNPs, viruses that lack NS2 resulted in reduced viral growth.
27 After genomic replication, transcription, and protein synthesis, NS2 and M1 help escort the new viral proteins to the host cell membrane, where they assemble and bud newly synthesized virions ( Figure 1, step 7).
28, 29 As the nascent virions bud from the host cell, NA cleaves the sialic acid residues on the host cell membrane,
30 which allows the viruses to escape the host membrane ( Figure 1, step 8).
31 Antiviral drugs that block NA activity result in influenza viruses accumulating at the membrane and cannot further disseminate to cause infection of neighboring cells.
32
